Package com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java

This package contains defines a client used to interact with a Mesos HTTP API such as the Scheduler HTTP API.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AwaitableSubscription
    A sub-interface of Subscription that provides the definition of a subscription that can be awaited.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MesosClient<Send,Receive>
    This class performs the necessary work to create an Observable of Receive from Mesos' HTTP APIs, one of which is the HTTP Scheduler API
    MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive>
    Builder used to create a MesosClient.
    MesosClientErrorContext
    This class represents the context of a request that is made to Mesos that resulted in an error.
    Rx
    A set of utilities related to Rx.
    SinkOperation<T>
    A simple object that represents a T that is to be sent to Mesos.
    SinkOperations
    This class provides the set of methods that can be used to create SinkOperations
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Mesos4xxException
    This class represents a client error (HTTP 400 series) occurred while sending a request to Mesos.
    Mesos5xxException
    This class represents a server error (HTTP 500 series) occurred while sending a request to Mesos.
    MesosException
    This class represents an error occurred while sending a request to Mesos.

Package com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java Description

This package contains defines a client used to interact with a Mesos HTTP API such as the Scheduler HTTP API.

Design

This library is designed to allow a user to interact with Mesos by defining a function that receives a stream (Observable) of Events from Mesos potentially emitting events of it's own that will be sent to Mesos.

However this function is implemented doesn't matter to the library, as long as the function contract is upheld.

This module is ignorant of the actual messages being sent and received from Mesos and the serialization mechanism used. Instead, the user provides a MessageCodec for each of the corresponding messages. The advantage of this is that the client can stay buffered from message changes made my Mesos as well as serialization used (the package com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.protobuf provides the codecs necessary to use protobuf when connecting to mesos).
